metadata.title: Wednesday, 31st July, 2019
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE TWELFTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Water Development, Sanitation and Environmental Protection
parts: (a) when the sinking of the 18 boreholes allocated to Lumezi District will commence;
(b) who the contractor for the project is;
(c) what the cost of the project is; and
(d) what the time frame for the completion of the project is.
(a) why the rehabilitation of dip tanks in the following areas in Kalomo Central Parliamentary Constituency has not commenced despite the contractor having been paid for the works:
(i) Tara                                            (iv) Katete; (ii) Katundulu;                                 (v) Simpuku; and (iii) Siampanyuma;                          (vi) Nanjame;
(b) when the rehabilitation works will commence;
(c) what the name of the contractor is;
(d) whether any action will be taken against the contractor for failure to commence the works; and
(e) if so, what action will be taken.
(a) at what stage of completion, in percentage terms, the project to tar the Chinsali-Mulilansolo road was, as of June, 2019;
(b) what the revised date for the completion of the project is; and
(c) what measures are being taken to ensure that the project is completed according to the revised date of completion.
(a) how many boreholes were earmarked for sinking in Mitete District in 2017 and 2018;
(b) how many boreholes were sunk in each year; and
(c) if no boreholes were sunk, why.
(a) how many primary schools were upgraded to secondary level in Luano District in 2018;
(b) of the schools above, how many received funds for infrastructure development, name by name;
(c) when infrastructure at (b) will be completed;
(d) what the cause of the delay in completing the projects is; and
(e) how much money has so far been spent on each project.
(a) why the construction of the Shungu Namutitima Secondary School in Livingstone District has stalled;
(b) when the works will resume;
(c) who the contractor for the project is;
(d) what the total cost of the project is; and
(e) what the time frame for the completion of the outstanding works, is.
(a) when the reconstruction  of the following bridges in Chadiza District, which were washed away, will commence:
(i) Chipwete; (ii) Kandewo; (iii) Mwangazi; and (iv) Mwami; and
(b) what the estimated cost of the works is.
(a) when the rehabilitation of the Ndunga Road, which connects Zambia to Angola via Manyinga Parliamentary Constituency, will commence;
(b) what the time frame for the completion of the project is; and
(c) what the total cost of the project is.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to rehabilitate the Chasato-Chikwa road in Chama South Parliamentary Constituency;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why.
(a) whether the following feeder roads in Nalikwanda Parliamentary Constituency are part of the countrywide 10,000 Kilometre Feeder Roads Construction Programme:
(i) Namushakende-Nakanyaa; (ii) Nakanyaa-Namaumba; (iii) Ndondo-Kasindangwa; (iv) Kaongela-Imalyo-Nakanyaa; and
(v) Nakanyaa-Netonga-Lukweta; and
(b) if the roads are not part of the Programme, why.
(a) when the reconstruction of the clinic at Nalolo Royal Village in Nalolo District will commence;
(b) what the cause of the delay in commencing the project is;
(c) how many structures will be constructed at the site;
(d) what the time frame for the completion of the project is; and
(e) what the total cost of the project is.
(a) when the Lusaka West Boarding School in Chilanga Parliamentary Constituency will be opened to the public; and
(b) what the cause of delay in opening the School is.
(a) when the  rehabilitation of the Katete-Chanida road, which is in a deplorable state, will commence; and
(b) why the state of the road has been allowed to deteriorate.

questions.question_text: Chimtende and Matunga Day Secondary Schools in Katete District will be connected to the national electricity grid.

parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to tar the Mwanza-Chivuna road in Moomba Parliamentary Constituency;
(b) if so, when the exercise will commence; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why.
(a) whether the Zambia Telecommunications Company Limited (Zamtel) declared any profits from 2012 to 2018;
(b) if so, how much profit was made in the period above, year by year;
(c) whether Zamtel was able to compete favourably with other mobile service providers; and
(d) whether the Government has any plans to either privatise or list Zamtel on the Lusaka Stock Exchange.
(a) when the agro-dealers who supplied farming inputs under the Farmer Input Support Programme for the 2018/2019 farming season will be paid;
(b) how much money in total was owed to the agro-dealers as of April, 2019; and
(c) what measures have been taken to ensure that in future, agro dealers are paid on time.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to connect Chirwa Island to the rest of Ngabwe District through an embankment;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) what the estimated cost of the project is.
(a) how much money was realised from the sale of Roan Antelope Mining Corporation of Zambia (RAMCOZ) Mine;
(b) who the liquidator was;
(c) how much was paid to the liquidator;
(d) whether there is any outstanding payment on the purchase price;
(e) if so, when the balance will be paid; and
(f) how many creditors had not been paid as of 31st January, 2019.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to construct a youth skills training centre in Siavonga District; and

(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented. NOTICE OF MOTION AND ORDER OF THE DAY The Minister of Finance Supply: That this House do now resolve into Committee of supply to consider Supplementary Estimates of Expenditure No. 1 of 2019. 1. The Food Safety Bill                                                                                   (N.A.B. 9/2019) Committee Stage ___________________________
